channel.title: CNN.com - U.S.
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2013 Cable News Network LP, LLLP.

image.title: CNN.com - U.S.
image.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: Amazing everyday hero stories
item.description: They clean up rivers, build homes for disabled veterans and bring health care to some of the darkest parts of the world.

item.title: Mom: I'm missing them grow up
item.description: Erin Hill had a long list of things she'd "never" do as a parent, but being a single mom has changed that. "I know I have to make peace with my choices," she writes, "but I'm not there yet."

item.title: New images of Saturn, Earth
item.description: NASA has given the people of Earth a rare treat: A color mosaic that captures not only Saturn, but also the tiny dots of Earth and other planets in the background.

item.title: Study: Ancient dogs domesticated
item.description: A new study in the journal Science argues that the domestication of dogs happened between 18,800 and 32,100 years ago in Europe.

item.title: Signs of life date back 3.5 billion years
item.description: Deep in a remote, hot, dry patch of northwestern Australia lies one of the earliest detectable signs of life on the planet, tracing back nearly 3.5 billion years, scientists say.

item.title: Obama 'frustrated and angry'
item.description: Gloria Borger says the no-drama White House culture helped set the stage for the Obamacare website fiasco

item.title: From traffic stop to colonoscopy
item.description: Danny Cevallos says police can get a warrant to search a person's body cavity, and typically get immunity from lawsuits

item.title: 'Homewrecker' a site for bullies
item.description: Peggy Drexler says betrayed women who post photos and slurs about their partners' mistresses on the "She's a Homewrecker" site are letting men off the hook and engaging in cruel bullying.

item.title: Dallas comes to terms with JFK
item.description: It's a shame that Jackie Kennedy, Robert Kennedy and Teddy Kennedy can't experience the transformation of Dallas and Texas from the dark days of John F. Kennedy's assassination in 1963 to the outpouring of tribute to him taking shape as the 50th anniversary approaches.

item.title: Don't buy Warren vs. Clinton
item.description: David Rothkopf says breathless speculation that newly minted Sen. Elizabeth Warren will challenge Hillary Clinton for the 2016 Democratic nod is cooked up by pundits who need news

item.title: Keeping Braves would've hurt city
item.description: Atlanta Mayor Kasim Reed says the city couldn't match the funding that the suburban Cobb County was willing to spend to build a new stadium for the Braves.

item.title: Childhood in the path of typhoons
item.description: Cecilia Brainard grew up in the Philippines, where people can tell a typhoon is coming from the smell of rain and know the ropes about staying safe. Still, Haiyan's power was beyond anyone's imagination or experience.

item.title: Where is Pussy Riot member?
item.description: Frida Ghitis says the imprisoned activist has disappeared, believed taken away by Russian authorities. She says silence of Putin regime's has shined light on its repression

item.title: Learn Lincoln's words by heart
item.description: In one week, our nation will celebrate the 150th anniversary of the Gettysburg Address. President Abraham Lincoln spoke for only two minutes. He started off by reminding his audience that it had been only 87 years since the country's founding, and then went on to embolden the Union cause with some of the most stirring words ever spoken.

item.title: Time to debate drones over U.S.
item.description: Daniel Suarez says the FAA is establishing six locations to try out safety and privacy approaches for the inevitable civilian drones in the airspace. It's a vital dialogue to get started

item.title: Fly us back to the moon
item.description: Lady Gaga announced that she's going to sing in space. Everyone is raving about "Gravity," the new movie starring Sandra Bullock and George Clooney as astronauts in orbit. And India just launched its first Mars mission on Thursday.

item.title: Kids shouldn't see 'Blue' movie
item.description: Pepper Schwartz says the suggestion that a parent should introduce a young teen to the sexually explicit "Blue Is the Warmest Color" is ridiculous.

item.title: Transgender Victoria's Secret model?
item.description: Victoria's Secret is synonymous with sultry femininity, and if Carmen Carrera had her way, that would include transgendered women as well.

item.title: Found 35 years after leaving U.S.
item.description: For a while there, Kathy Amaya thought her long-lost son was gone forever.

item.title: Baldwin stalker gets 210 days
item.description: A Canadian woman who said actor Alec Baldwin promised her "omelets every morning" for the rest of her life after a sexual encounter was found guilty Thursday of stalking and harassing the 30 Rock star.

item.title: Woman pulled from car in pond
item.description: A woman is rescued after she says her steering wheel locked en route to a mechanic, causing her to crash in a pond.

item.title: Civil War relic raised to surface
item.description: She didn't have enough power to maneuver and effectively trade artillery rounds with enemy vessels in the swift Savannah River. Instead, the locally produced CSS Georgia, a one-of-a-kind ironclad produced for the Confederacy during the Civil War, became a stationary floating battery, bristling with artillery pieces.

item.title: Pilot: 'We're going down'
item.description: As his plane made a rapid descent to normalize cabin pressure, a Southwest Airlines pilot apparently told passengers the aircraft was going down. Thankfully, it did not, instead making an emergency landing in North Carolina.

item.title: 4 Marines killed at Camp Pendleton
item.description: Four Marines were killed Wednesday during a range maintenance operation at Camp Pendleton in California, the military said.

item.title: Fears grow over 3-D printed guns
item.description: CNN Justice correspondent Evan Perez reports on growing fears over 3-D printed guns.

item.title: Surfer missing after Oahu wipeout
item.description: Authorities will continue searching Thursday for an experienced surfer who is missing after wiping out on a 20-foot wave off Oahu's North Shore, according to a CNN affiliate.

item.title: Warhol sold for $105.4 million
item.description: A famously macabre painting by Andy Warhol sold for $105.4 million Wednesday, a record for the famed pop artist and the second-most expensive piece of art ever auctioned, according to Sotheby's auction house.

item.title: Surfer missing after wiping out on 20-foot Oahu wave
item.description: Authorities will continue searching Thursday for an experienced surfer who is missing after wiping out on a 20-foot wave off Oahu's North Shore, according to a CNN affiliate.

item.title: 4 Marines killed at Camp Pendleton during maintenance operation
item.description: Four Marines were killed Wednesday during a range maintenance operation at Camp Pendleton in California, the military said.

item.title: Passenger falls from plane off Florida coast; rescuers searching
item.description: Rescuers are searching for a passenger who reportedly fell from a plane off Florida's coast, authorities said Thursday.

item.title: Cops: Gunman put baby down, fled
item.description: Police found the man they wanted to arrest at the Children's Hospital of Wisconsin holding a child. Instead of surrendering, the man took out a handgun and fled down a hallway, after which police shot him, a sheriff said.

item.title: Pilot apparently tells passengers: 'We're going down'
item.description: As his plane made a rapid descent to normalize cabin pressure, a Southwest Airlines pilot apparently told passengers the aircraft was going down. Instead, the plane made an emergency landing in North Carolina.

item.title: Fears grow over 3-D printed guns
item.description: CNN Justice correspondent Evan Perez reports on growing fears over 3-D printed guns.

item.title: Sinkhole swallows part of house
item.description: Homeowner Mike Dupre describes how his home fell into a sinkhole in Florida.

item.title: Who do people prefer -- male or female boss?
item.description: In a new poll of 2,059 adults, Gallup found that Americans still prefer a male boss over a female one.

item.title: Passengers lack info on cruise ship crime
item.description: Vegas stole the slogan. But cruise ships can also lay claim: Whatever happens on cruise ships, stays on cruise ships.

item.title: Classes canceled to deal with race issues
item.description: Oberlin College in Ohio suspended classes Monday after a student reported seeing a person resembling a Ku Klux Klan member near the college's Afrikan Heritage House.

item.title: Watch Friday's Show!
item.description: November 15, 2013

item.title: Dog wants kitty love
item.description: This cute dog just wants some attention from his kitty friend.

item.title: Slacklining is for not slackers
item.description: Slacklining and its daring stunts are catching on in California. KERO's Kristina Zverjako reports.

item.title: Best baby announcement ever?
item.description: A couple from Utah found a creative way to announce their pregnancy to friends and family.
